title: 旧约 - 约伯记(Job) - 第 32 章
subTitle: 旧约 -- 约伯记(Job) -- 第 32 章 ( 本篇共有 42 章 )

lineList.en: So these three men ceased to answer Job, because he was righteous in his own eyes.
lineList.cn: 于是这三个人，因约伯自以为义就，不再回答他。

lineList.en: Then was kindled the wrath of Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite, of the kindred of Ram: against Job was his wrath kindled, because he justified himself rather than God.
lineList.cn: 那时有布西人，兰族巴拉迦的儿子，以利户向约伯发怒。因约伯自以为义，不以神为义。

lineList.en: Also against his three friends was his wrath kindled, because they had found no answer, and yet had condemned Job.
lineList.cn: 他又向约伯的三个朋友发怒。因为他们想不出回答的话来，仍以约伯为有罪。

lineList.en: Now Elihu had waited till Job had spoken, because they were elder than he.
lineList.cn: 以利户要与约伯说话，就等候他们，因为他们比自己年老。

lineList.en: When Elihu saw that there was no answer in the mouth of these three men, then his wrath was kindled.
lineList.cn: 以利户见这三个人口中无话回答，就怒气发作。

lineList.en: And Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite answered and said, I am young, and ye are very old; wherefore I was afraid, and durst not shew you mine opinion.
lineList.cn: 布西人，巴拉迦的儿子，以利户回答说，我年轻，你们老迈。因此我退让，不敢向你们陈说我的意见。

lineList.en: I said, Days should speak, and multitude of years should teach wisdom.
lineList.cn: 我说，年老的当先说话。寿高的当以智慧教训人。

lineList.en: But there is a spirit in man: and the inspiration of the Almighty giveth them understanding.
lineList.cn: 但在人里面有灵，全能者的气使趟有聪明。

lineList.en: Great men are not always wise: neither do the aged understand judgment.
lineList.cn: 尊贵的不都有智慧。寿高的不都能明白公平。

lineList.en: Therefore I said, Hearken to me; I also will shew mine opinion.
lineList.cn: 因此我说，你们要听我言，我也要陈说我的意见。

lineList.en: Behold, I waited for your words; I gave ear to your reasons, whilst ye searched out what to say.
lineList.cn: 你们查究所要说的话。那时我等候你们的话，侧耳听你们的辩论。

lineList.en: Yea, I attended unto you, and, behold, there was none of you that convinced Job, or that answered his words:
lineList.cn: 留心听你们。谁知你们中间无一人折服约伯，驳倒他的话。

lineList.en: Lest ye should say, We have found out wisdom: God thrusteth him down, not man.
lineList.cn: 你们切不可说，我们寻得智慧。神能胜他，人却不能。

lineList.en: Now he hath not directed his words against me: neither will I answer him with your speeches.
lineList.cn: 约伯没有向我争辩。我也不用你们的话回答他。

lineList.en: They were amazed, they answered no more: they left off speaking.
lineList.cn: 他们惊奇不再回答，一言不发。

lineList.en: When I had waited, (for they spake not, but stood still, and answered no more;)
lineList.cn: 我岂因他们不说话，站住不再回答，仍旧等候呢。

lineList.en: I said, I will answer also my part, I also will shew mine opinion.
lineList.cn: 我也要回答我的一分话，陈说我的意见。

lineList.en: For I am full of matter, the spirit within me constraineth me.
lineList.cn: 因为我的言语满怀。我里面的灵激动我。

lineList.en: Behold, my belly is as wine which hath no vent; it is ready to burst like new bottles.
lineList.cn: 我的胸怀如盛酒之囊，没有出气之缝，又如新皮袋快要破裂。

lineList.en: I will speak, that I may be refreshed: I will open my lips and answer.
lineList.cn: 我要说话，使我舒畅。我要开口回答。

lineList.en: Let me not, I pray you, accept any man's person, neither let me give flattering titles unto man.
lineList.cn: 我必不看人的情面，也不奉承人。

lineList.en: For I know not to give flattering titles; in so doing my maker would soon take me away.
lineList.cn: 我不晓得奉承。若奉承，造我的主必快快除灭我。
